snippet: On Friday, President Obama and President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan will confront vastly different positions on future American troop levels and other issues.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama and Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai will confront vastly different positions on future American troop levels and other issues during scheduled meeting; Obama is contemplating vast reduction, or even elimination, of troops in Afghanistan and Karzai is counting on substantial residual troop presence.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER, MICHAEL R. GORDON and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

lead_paragraph: On Friday, President Obama and President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan will confront vastly different positions on future American troop levels and other issues.

headline.seo: Karzai and Obama to Meet to Discuss Forces in Afghanistan
headline.main: Priorities Are Far Apart as Karzai and Obama Meet
headline.print_headline: Priorities Are Far Apart For Karzai and Obama

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
